title: Synthetic Recap
body:
CLEVELAND — In an era defined by its big men, one colossal performance stood above all others. On a night where offense was a premium, Arvydas Sabonis delivered a performance for the ages, single-handedly carrying the Portland Trail Blazers to a gritty 86-84 victory over the Cleveland Cavaliers at Gund Arena.

The final score belies the dominance of the man in the middle. Sabonis, the towering Lithuanian center, was an unstoppable force, pouring in a game-high 44 points. He was the epicenter of the entire contest, scoring over half of his team's points in a defensive slugfest. Every time the Cavaliers threatened, the ball went into the low post, and Sabonis delivered with a dizzying array of hook shots, put-backs, and powerful moves in the paint.

While Sabonis was a one-man wrecking crew, he received just enough support to seal the win. Isaiah Rider added 19 points, providing a crucial secondary scoring option. For the Cavaliers, Shawn Kemp fought valiantly, recording a double-double with 23 points and 14 rebounds, but his efforts were ultimately drowned out by the Sabonis tidal wave.

The game came down to the final possession, with Cleveland desperately seeking a basket to tie or win. But the story had already been written by the 7'3" center whose shadow loomed over the final, frantic seconds. This was not just a win; it was a historic statement. Sabonis’s 44-point masterpiece was a testament to his legendary skill and power, a night where one man’s will decided the fate of an entire game.
